as we were in there welcome to motherhood it tough have two little boys ve wanted so badly to wrap them in bubble wrap in safe room dread the tree climbing days the day they are allowed to walk to friend house alone etc be strong momma we can do it is it possible you have anxiety it pretty common for kids to get into things like you re describing while not ideal eating screw will not cause you to lose him on the other hand you need to be able to let your guard down do you have spot in your house you could create room like you re describing hey if it helps any noticed you said close calls it means you re watching him it means you re aware it means you re doing good job toddlers are the best at finding the worst things to play with sometimes caught mine headed to the outlet with key to unlock it scary we do the best we can to childproof and it an ever changing situation every situation is an opportunity for learning experience for them and us keep on doing your best there will be times you ll catch them with things in their mouth read fucking stupid barbie toys etc and just know it happens take deep breath realize you re being great mom because your so concerned and keep an eye out for what he goes after so you can do your best to either dissuade him or remove it completely also maybe try different toys if you can sometimes mine goes after dumb shit when she bored with like the electrical outlets but things like climbing he will do it and he will hurt himself and that how eventually he will learn what should or should be climbed he 26 months now and just shocked we have had an er visit yet my youngest is like this and swear she gave me several grey hairs once found her on top of the fridge after went to the bathroom one day another time she managed to get out of her baby proofed bedroom to climb on top of the counter and grab my meat cleaver she then ran with the cleaver and then swung it down and it stuck into the linoleum in the kitchen there is only so much you can do really you can baby proof watch the kid as much as possible too but sometimes theyre just insane little suicide monsters it sounds like youre doing your best and that is all you can do really take breath days ago was actively watching my almost 15mo as she was running around the room in split second she tripped and hit her nose on the tv stand there were tears and blood everywhere and black eye felt like the worst mom ever how did it happen was watching her it just kids being kids they get hurt and it kills us little just keep an eye on him keep the area tidy and make sure you know what to do if something happens choking cpr numbers to call etc find being prepared for the worst helps be deal with things better insane little suicide monsters lol sounds like my two year old you poor mama meat cleaver feel for you know it hard to see the positives here but it the way got through that stage as we put it our son had no sense of self preservation climbing tumbling disassembling and eating everything he was constantly getting to everything he was so curious and determined but because of my vigilance and because of your vigilance he ll be fine it stressful and understand that but think of that fantastic curious mind he has he problem solver questioning builder he wants to take it all apart and put it back together again and understand why it works he wants to know why things fall down instead of up and what sounds different objects make on every kind of floor he discovering and he devouring information from the world around him remind yourself of that next time you re having breakdown over him eating your deodorant or trying to plug phone charger into his ear or defying all forms of childlocks my son is five now and is still that kid ca leave him alone for too long he is just as curious as he always was but now far more capable of trouble but he also understands boundaries and rules now which is relief he just so bright and eager to learn and be independent he wants to know how to make his own noodles and wants to help change the tires on the cars his mind is always working it my favorite thing about him that not to say that do still find him with foreign objects in his mouth or playing with bugs or peeling paint off the walls still have to watch him like crazy because he curious and constantly needing stimulation it ll get better as he gets more communicative and receptive to instruction being pregnant makes it all seem so much more hopeless know 28 weeks now myself and go through my bouts of frustration and self doubt practically every other hour just take some time to watch that beautiful mind work and you ll come to see it as the positive that it is that definitely takes the edge of some of frustration mine is also of soon to be children the idea of having toddler and newborn has been really stressing me out maybe just too old for this stuff now all of my other kids were spaced farther apart also have an
